I think there were a couple of factors that made that tackle on Tuilagi so outrageous. At this period, Tuilagi was virtually unstoppable. It would always take two or three players to take him down so for Warburton to stop him from 5 yards out was quite impressive.
Secondly the sheer depth he managed to get to you wrap himself around Manu's ankles was an achievement in itself. I think this submission is more for the technicality than awe factor.
Never seen the BOD one before very similar!
What kind of genre would you prefer for future reference?
Thanks Jon as always
In my opinion the almighty was more known for his deceptive rucking rather than tackling. (He was still a great tackler) If I ever made a video on great steals he would be right up there.
He didn't put a foot wrong in 2005.

WRITING.TITLE: After much deliberation, I bring you a collection of the filthiest, hardest and most technical tackles in Rugby. Chosen by you. Rugby players were harmed in the making of this montage.

WRITING.TEXT: My mistake. Jonny would simply not allow that. Void my monologue! #MayMasterRace
Have you ever seen a filthier bench!

Well, its the 78th minute. England are winning 19-14 in a gruelling yet entertaining match. The chorus of Swing Low is bellowing from the stands as Eddie Jones does his best to conceal a grin. Jonny May weaves down left wing and places the ball ba-
DAVID POCOCK swoops in akin a wallaby on acid prizing the ball from Jonny's timid fingers, he flies down the wing swatting away Farrell with his bear shaped paws. He surges over the whitewash swiftly followed by Hooper wooping harder than a Freshman after his first keg. This is their moment. 19-19 time to get payback for that disgusting, horrifying summer. Foley steps up. The crowd trying to maintain decorum shhh themselves into a respectful silence. He swoops the ball to the left of the sticks. Pocock gets his glory and England get a pissy little draw.
[Poor lads](http://imgur.com/pLgGpOz)
20? Such confidence!
Put a 5 on it.
Was a great read.
Interesting view. Bold claim about Ireland being better than England though. May the 6 nations decide the bragging rights!
I know! It's unbelievable that a man of his size had that amount of speed and agility.

I think Australia are going to bring a massive game this weekend. They have absolutely nothing to lose in this game after losing the pressure of a tour 'grand slam'. To lose to England 4 times in a year is unheard of for a chain shackler so I tentatively presume an Australia win.
17-25

WRITING.TITLE: Rugby Giveaway Suggestions.
WRITING.TEXT:
Hello lads. As some of you may know I own a very small [Youtube](https://www.facebook.com/RugbyRulesShowcase/?ref=aymt_homepage_panel) channel and [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/RugbyRulesShowcase/?ref=aymt_homepage_panel) page.
I have been looking to gain followers for some time and I am going to do a "Like and share" giveaway soon to get a bit of a larger following.
I was wondering if any of our community had any interesting items or kit that they could suggest to give away. In addition to this if anybody is interested in selling me some items then comment below and I'll get in touch!
Thanks,
Rugby Rules!

WRITING.TITLE: Here is a collection of my videos from the last 8 months with a couple of extra videos bits of footage from "Rugby XV". Hope you enjoy!

WRITING.TEXT:
Seeing as nobody has posted an England XV I'll give my attempt.
1. Jason Leonard
2. Steve Thompson 3. Phil Vickery 4. Martin Johnson 5. Maro Itoje 6. Richard Hill 7. Neil Back 8. Lawrence Dallaglio 9. Matt Dawson 10. Jonny Wilkinson 11. Rory Underwood 12. Mike Catt 13. Jeremy Guscott 14. Ben Cohen 15. Jason Robinson Obviously dominated by the Golden Era however I had to include Itoje as he is going to be a great for England.

My University Halls has a very relaxed parking system so you could park there for the day until 9pm and they would be non the wiser. Only issue is that it's a mile from the stadium so could be a long walk back when you're more smashed than a victim of Courtney Lawes.
Bloody Blooderson!
Cheers, appreciate it!
Thanks a lot!
As is tradition.

That's a very fair comment. I would have loved to have gone down that line however because the match was filmed in the US there was very VERY little replays or slow motion images. Therefore it is hard to combine a more epic soundtrack to your stock sideline footage.
Before the game I had in mind getting some slo motion images of the hake and the foley "8" circle to build some atmosphere. However there was simply no images used by the host company. Therefore I had to use what I could which wasn't that great.
Really wish the BBC had filmed it!!
I'm in the same boat but just had to do one for this game. Thanks for the nice comment!

WRITING.TITLE: The "Pied Piper"
[S6] Stumbled upon this tribute to Season 6. Very well made and poignant in my opinion.

WRITING.TEXT:
I have not much knowledge of what teams are prominent in American Rugby however I will attempt to give you an overview of rugby in Europe.
In my head rugby is the second biggest sport here apart from football (soccer). International matches always draw in huge crowds here and it is a great event. Union is without a doubt the more popular apart from maybe in the North of England where cities like Leeds and Hull enjoy a dominance in League. I would suggest You tubing a beginners guide to rugby union. Either way rugby is an excellent way to meet people and it will affect your life in a positive way. Message me for further info and questions.
Trust me. Get into RUGBY.

WRITING.TITLE: Thought you might want to watch all of this trailer reaction from The Dark Knight Rises (2012)
[Main Spoilers] I would have loved to have seen this.
WRITING.TEXT:
I think that Game of Thrones could have created some unreal hype before the Battle of the Bastards. I would have loved to have seen a promo showing the Boltons preparing to flay someone. The camera could cut to the victim on the cross looking terrified whilst there were short, fleeting glimpses of a man sharpening a blade. This suspense would continue building until the flaying is about to start when the promo cuts out. All mixed in with tense music and dark imagery this could have been a truly tense but amazing promo.
Flaying is what makes the Bolton's such a formidable and feared house in my opinion. This may have been a bit over the top but does anyone else not want to know more about their strange and twisted tradition?
Ah I might try that. It is just so frustrating how they don't even warn about quicktime not being used after the update it's ridiculous!
Thank you so much it worked. I can't see a screen recording option though. All I see is, audio, movie and player
Thanks mate, do you have to buy the pro version and will it do reliable screen recording or just 'movie' recordings?

WRITING.TITLE: Quicktime Player will not properly screen record on Quick Time Player after recent update. What can I do?
WRITING.TEXT:

Alternatively can anybody suggest an alternative screen capture program that has no image performance loss that is free?
Thanks
